intro: Colobanthus strictus, commonly known as the narrowleaf willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and Antarctic regions. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or coastal environments. The plant has slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences and are usually pink or purple in color. Colobanthus strictus is adapted to cold climates and is often found in areas with poor soil conditions.
